comments.html: I needed to read this post today, thank you. Doing "nothing" is fantastic.

I have plenty of memories listening to Moby as well. I remember jumping in my parents Prado immediately after school when we'd go down south for a holiday.

It'd be a Friday afternoon just before a long weekend, so we'd always be trying to beat the traffic. Inevitably, the freeway would clog, and traffic would come to a slow, meaning the blackness of night would be well and truly set in by the time we ended up at our destination.

The Prado's CD player's eject mechanism was busted, so we only had the discs already stuck in the player to choose from. Moby's Play was one of those CDs.

Whenever I listen to the album, it takes me back to being a little kid half-asleep in the backseat of the car as we drove through the Aussie bush while darkness crept in around us and the semi-ethereal sounds of the album played.

Whenever an artist I like releases a new album, I love sitting down with it and listening to it from start to end with full attention.

So without doing anything else at the same time. No reading, commuting or chores.

I can definitely recommend giving it a try!
Oh my yes. I used to just lay around and listen to music all the time. God, I haven't done that in ages. I think I know what I'm going to do tonight. :)
